summary: Mel Waxman was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents indicate that Waxman was on the HSCA payroll from at least October 1977 through November 1978. The documents list Waxman's name, position, and salary. One document mentions the Assassination Records Review Board's decision to postpone the release of HSCA staff payroll records, redacting Social Security numbers, and references payroll authorization forms for Mel Waxman.
significance: Mel Waxman's significance lies in his employment with the HSCA, the committee tasked with investigating the assassination of JFK. As a staff member, his payroll records are part of the historical documentation related to the HSCA's operations and personnel.
